thread.title: Cambridge voices support for refugees
thread.title_full: Cambridge voices support for refugees | Anglia - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Cambridge voices support for refugees
text:
A campaigner makes their feelings known at the march Credit: ITV Anglia Around 300 people of all ages set out from Parker's Piece to parade through Cambridge city centre today in support of refugees.
"Huge numbers of people have been making offers of accommodation and and offering their skills and services and it just goes to show people really care. It's up to our leaders to respond to that and do something about it."
– Stefan Haselwimmer, Cambridge Refugee Resettlement Campaign Shoppers watched the march go past Credit: ITV Anglia Saturday shoppers stopped in their tracks as the parade passed by on its way to the Guildhall.
The Cambridge Refugee Resettlement Campaign marched with other local groups supported by the local MP. Daniel Zeichner acknowledged not everybody in the East of England is keen to see more people settle here.
"I understand why people are worried, but when you look at the scales of the human tragedy that's unfolding, are we really saying that we can't do anything approaching what other countries can do?"
– Daniel Zeichner MP The Government says it will resettle people living in refugee camps in Syria, Turkey and Jordan by 2020 and will prioritise vulnerable children, but these people say, 20,000 is just too few.
Click below to watch a report by ITV's Wesley Smith:
